intro: Cardanthera brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom from late spring to early summer. Cardanthera brevituba is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
